Package ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit

Class InputHandler

java.lang.Object
ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.InputHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
KeyListener, EventListener
public class InputHandler extends Object implements KeyListener
Input handlers map the user key strokes into commands. A newly created input handler has no key bindings assigned. A default command set that is suitable for most purposes can be installed by calling addDefaultKeyBindings(). A number of built-in actions are available. These can be found in the EditorCommands class as static fields. They can also be listed by name via getActionNames() in order to create command sets dynamically.
Since:
3.0

      public void addDefaultKeyBindings()

    • addKeyBinding

      public void addKeyBinding​(String keyBinding, ActionListener action)
      Adds a key binding that maps a sequence of one or more key strokes to an action. Key strokes are separated from each other using a comma. Individual key strokes are decoded as if by passing them to parseKeyStroke(java.lang.String).
      Parameters:
      keyBinding - the key binding description
      action - the action to bind to the key sequence

    • addKeyBinding

      public void addKeyBinding​(KeyStroke key, ActionListener action)
      Adds a key binding that maps a single key stroke to an action.
      Parameters:
      key - the key stroke to bind
      action - the action to assign to the key

    • removeAllKeyBindings

      public void removeAllKeyBindings()
      Removes all key bindings from this input handler.

    • getKeyStrokeForAction

      public KeyStroke getKeyStrokeForAction​(ActionListener action)
      Returns a key stroke attached to the action, or null. This searches the root-level bindings for the action and returns the first matching key stroke. If the specified action is not bound, or it is only bound to a multi-stroke sequence, then this will return null.
      Parameters:
      action - the action to look up
      Returns:
      a single key stroke that activates the action, or null

    • getActionForKeyStroke

      public ActionListener getActionForKeyStroke​(KeyStroke keysStroke)
      Returns the action that is associated with the given key stroke, or null. This method will only return actions that do not require multiple key strokes.
      Parameters:
      keysStroke - the key stroke to look up
      Returns:
      the action associated with the key stroke, or null

    • interceptNextKeyStroke

      public void interceptNextKeyStroke​(ActionListener interceptor)
      Processes the next key stroke with the supplied listener. Normal key processing will then resume (unless this method is called again, possibly from the listener itself). Calling this method with a null parameter will clear an interceptor that is currently waiting to fire. When the listener is called, the source of the event will be an instance of InterceptSource.
      Parameters:
      interceptor - the listener that will be called to intercept the key

    • getRepeatCount

      public int getRepeatCount()
      Returns the number of times the next action will be repeated. This will return one if repeat mode is not enabled. (By default, repeat mode is activated from the editor by pressing Ctrl+Enter, then typing the number of times the action should be repeated, then pressing the key stroke for the action to repeat.)
      Returns:
      the number of times the next action will be repeated (normally one)

    • setRepeatCount

      public void setRepeatCount​(int repeatCount)
      Sets the number of times the next action will be repeated.
      Parameters:
      repeatCount - the number of times to repeat the action

    • getActionRecorder

      public ActionRecorder getActionRecorder()
      Returns the current action recorder.
      Returns:
      the current action recorder, or null

    • setActionRecorder

      public void setActionRecorder​(ActionRecorder recorder)
      Sets the current action recorder. When non-null, actions will be forwarded to the recorder before execution.
      Parameters:
      recorder - the macro recorder

    • isMacroRecorded

      public boolean isMacroRecorded()
      Returns true if a macro has been recorded using the EditorCommands.BEGIN_MACRO and EditorCommands.END_MACRO actions.
      Returns:
      true if an action has been recorded

      public Macro getMacro()

      Returns:
      the current macro recording

      Parameters:

      See Also:

    • copy

      public InputHandler copy()
      Returns a copy of this input handler that shares the same key bindings. Setting key bindings in the copy will also set them in the original.

      public void keyPressed​(KeyEvent event)
      Handle a key pressed event. This will look up the binding for the key stroke and execute it.

      Parameters:
      event - the event to handle

    • keyTyped

      public void keyTyped​(KeyEvent event)
      Handle a key typed event. This inserts the typed key into the text area.
      Specified by:
      keyTyped in interface KeyListener
      Parameters:
      event - the event to handle

      Specified by:

    • executeAction

      public void executeAction​(ActionListener listener, Object source, String actionCommand)
      Executes the specified action. The action will be repeated or recorded it if an action recorder or repeat count is set. This can be used to simulate the user entering commands.
      Parameters:
      listener - the action to execute
      source - the event source; this should be set to the editor that you want to execute the command unless you have specific information otherwise
      actionCommand - the action command; some actions may change their behaviour depending on this value, while others will ignore it

    • handleInterceptor

      protected void handleInterceptor​(KeyEvent evt, boolean isTyped)
      Handles key interception by creating an appropriate InterceptSource, clearing the intercept flag, and calling the interceptor.
      Parameters:
      evt - the key event that triggered the intercept
      isTyped - true for typed events, false for pressed events

    • parseKeyStroke

      public static KeyStroke parseKeyStroke​(String keyStroke)
      Converts a string to a single key stroke. The string may use one of two formats: the verbose format use by the KeyStroke class, or a compact format that requires less typing. The compact format uses the form [modifiers*+]key. Here,modifiers represents a sequence of one or more modifier keys. Each modifier is represented by a single letter:

      P Platform-specific menu accelerator key (Control on most platforms; Command on OS X)
      M Meta (Command)
      C Control
      A Alt
      S Shift
      G AltGr (not recommended for shortcut keys)

      Examples:
      HOME
      ctrl X
      ctrl alt DELETE
      C+X
      CA+DELETE

      Parameters:
      keyStroke - the string description of the key stroke, in one of the two supported formats
      Returns:
      a KeyStroke for the string description, or null
